Text: REVISED Weekly Cost Reports Cc a revised and updated Weekly Cost Report Please review the changes which I have summarized below and call if you have any questions Thanks Amy For the Wilton and Gleason projects the Current Forecast was overstated by the amounts paid to Nepco on April the th This resulted in a significant erroneous variance of about million In other words I didnt reduce the forecast by the amount of the payment The unapproved Acceleration Scope change on Lincoln approximately million has been broken out separately to be consistent with the other projects as a separate variance explanation The EECC Fixed Fee of million per project has been removed from both the Original Budget and Current Forecast as requested by Dave Delainey

Weekly Cost Summary Cc the Cost Reports These reports only include actuals through January cost will not be posted until all year end Project Tracking has been purged which will be the week of the th Therefore the next report will be which will include January activity I have also updated the Scope Change tab for Wilton to include the amounts that ENA has approved for each scope change However Nepcos Current Forecast still has the original amount of each Scope Change and therefore is overstated As soon as Nepcos forecast is reduced by the agreed to changes I will reflect the reduced cost in my Forecast If you have any questions please give me a call Thanks Amy

Weekly Cost Summary Cc Month Year End closing and updating of scope changes this weeks report will not go out until next week Sorry for any inconvenience this may cause If you have any questions please give me a call Thanks Amy

Weekly Cost Summary Reports Cc find the Weekly cost reports Please make note that there are upward forecast changes with respect to the Nepco reimbursables In the case of Lincoln center Nepco increased their Current Forecast over the last few months to million over original budget Dave Kristich has been and is currently in the process of reviewing and questioning every line item in all scope changes According to Dave the Nepco forecast will be coming down once he has had a chance to do a complete analysis and Nepco has had a chance to revisecorrect the scope changes Mike Through ENA has paid Nepco million in reimbursable dollars with Nepco showing actuals of million spent through Essentially ENA has fronted Nepco million to cover Decembers bills If you have any questions please give me a call Thanks Amy
